text: Boolean-valued usually refers to: * in most applied fields: something taking one of two values (example: True or False, On or Off, 1 or 0) referring to two-element Boolean algebra (the Boolean domain), e.g. Boolean-valued function or Boolean data type * in mathematics: something taking values over an arbitrary, abstract Boolean algebra, for example Boolean-valued model == See also == * Boolean algebra further explains the distinction Category:Mathematical concepts Category:Logic and statistics
title: Boolean-valued
